page.title: 13Eighty Years of Change.
page.content: This report is based on an interview with an elderly lady who has lived in the village all her life. Considerable changes have taken place both in appearance and in lifestyle. The village at the turn of this century consisted mainly of a straggle of cottages along the High Street and clusters of cottages at Blackwell End and Church End.The roads themselves were no more than dusty lanes and were safe places to walk due to the lack of traffic. Transport was mainly by horse and cart and bicycles were extremely expensive and very few people could afford one of these.
